action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: Starting with a commonly used five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants, which increases the chances of getting at least one or two correct letters.
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = imply
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since all letters in the previous guess were incorrect, the next guess will be a new five-letter word that is unrelated to "house" and has a different set of letters, to maximize the chances of getting at least one correct letter.
guess: brain

attempts = 2
target_word = imply
guess = brain
guess_feedback = b<red> r<red> a<red> i<yellow> n<red>

guess_feedback: b<red> r<red> a<red> i<yellow> n<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "i" in the previous guess was marked yellow, indicating it is present in the target word but not in the correct position. The next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes "i" and excludes the letters "b", "r", "a", and "n" to utilize the given feedback.
guess: pivot

attempts = 3
target_word = imply
guess = pivot
guess_feedback = p<yellow> i<yellow> v<red> o<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: p<yellow> i<yellow> v<red> o<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "p" and "i" in the previous guess were marked yellow, indicating they are present in the target word but not in the correct positions. The next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes "p" and "i" and excludes the letters "v", "o", and "t" to build upon the given feedback.
guess: picks

attempts = 4
target_word = imply
guess = picks
guess_feedback = p<yellow> i<yellow> c<red> k<red> s<red>

guess_feedback: p<yellow> i<yellow> c<red> k<red> s<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "p" and "i" in the previous guess were marked yellow again, confirming their presence in the target word but not in the correct positions. The next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes "p" and "i" and excludes the letters "c", "k", and "s" to narrow down the possibilities.
guess: pinky

attempts = 5
target_word = imply
guess = pinky
guess_feedback = p<yellow> i<yellow> n<red> k<red> y<green>

guess_feedback: p<yellow> i<yellow> n<red> k<red> y<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "p" and "i" in the previous guess were marked yellow again, and the letter "y" was marked green, indicating it is in the correct position. The next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes "p", "i", and "y" in the correct position for "y", and excludes the letters "n" and "k" to utilize the given feedback.
guess: pitys
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: llama-3.1-405b) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "p" and "i" in the previous guess were marked yellow, and the letter "y" was marked green. Considering the correct position of "y" and the presence of "p" and "i", the next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes these letters and forms a valid English word.
guess: pixie

attempts = 6
target_word = imply
guess = pixie
guess_feedback = p<yellow> i<yellow> x<red> i<red> e<red>
game_result = LOSS

guess_explanation: Starting with a commonly used five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants, which increases the chances of getting at least one or two correct letters.

Since all letters in the previous guess were incorrect, the next guess will be a new five-letter word that is unrelated to "house" and has a different set of letters, to maximize the chances of getting at least one correct letter.

The letter "i" in the previous guess was marked yellow, indicating it is present in the target word but not in the correct position. The next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes "i" and excludes the letters "b", "r", "a", and "n" to utilize the given feedback.

The letters "p" and "i" in the previous guess were marked yellow, indicating they are present in the target word but not in the correct positions. The next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes "p" and "i" and excludes the letters "v", "o", and "t" to build upon the given feedback.

The letters "p" and "i" in the previous guess were marked yellow again, confirming their presence in the target word but not in the correct positions. The next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes "p" and "i" and excludes the letters "c", "k", and "s" to narrow down the possibilities.

The letters "p" and "i" in the previous guess were marked yellow, and the letter "y" was marked green. Considering the correct position of "y" and the presence of "p" and "i", the next guess will be a new five-letter word that includes these letters and forms a valid English word.
